com.rapidminer.extension.indatabase.provider

Interface DatabaseProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmbeddedProvider, GenericProvider, GoogleBigQueryProvider, MySQLProvider, PostgreSQLProvider

    public interface DatabaseProvider

      • supportsInfinity

        default boolean supportsInfinity()
        Specifies if the database can handle Infinity values in filter expressions. If this function returns true (default), the provider must implement escapeInfinity(String).
        Returns:

      • escapeInfinity

        default java.lang.String escapeInfinity(java.lang.String val)
        If supportsInfinity() returns true, the provider must be able to format infinity values. This function accepts a value in RapidMiner format and if there is an Infinity value in it, it must change it to a format that the database recognizes.
        Parameters:
        val -
        Returns:

      • formatDate

        default java.lang.String formatDate(java.lang.String val)
        This function re-formats the date format in filter expressions to comply with the format used by the database.
        Parameters:
        val -
        Returns:

      • getFirstNonNullExpr

        default java.lang.String getFirstNonNullExpr()
        This function should return the database-specific COALESCE function - the function that takes the first non-null value. Returned String should refer to the two String inputs using '%s'.
        Returns:

      • getFilterSyntax

        default java.util.Map<Filter.FilterCondition,java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getFilterSyntax()
        Each Filter.FilterCondition must be translated to a DB-specific expression. The map returned by this function contains a (String,String)-to-String function for each condition. Each of those functions converts the column and condition value into an expression implementing the filter. Helper methods like escapeInfinity(String), escapeLikeExpr(String) must be properly implemented.
        Returns:
